question: Which nation's army was defeated when God caused confusion in their camp with a loud noise?
explanation: The Lord thundered with a mighty sound against the Philistines and threw them into confusion.

verses.kjv: And as Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel: but the LORD thundered with a great thunder on that day upon the Philistines, and discomfited them; and they were smitten before Israel.

question: Which judge killed King Eglon of Moab?
explanation: Ehud, a left-handed man, assassinated the obese King Eglon with a sword hidden on his right thigh.

verses.kjv: And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:

question: How many brothers of Goliath are mentioned in the Bible?
explanation: Lahmi, brother of Goliath, and another unnamed brother are mentioned as giants killed by David's men.

verses.kjv:
And there was war again with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear staff
was
 like a weaver’s beam.

question: What happened to Achan after the defeat at Ai?
choices: He was stoned for taking devoted things
explanation: Joshua said, 'Why have you brought trouble on us?' Then all Israel stoned Achan and his family.

verses.kjv: And Joshua said, Why hast thou troubled us? the LORD shall trouble thee this day. And all Israel stoned him with stones, and burned them with fire, after they had stoned them with stones.

question: What weapon did Shamgar use to strike down 600 Philistines?
explanation: After Ehud came Shamgar, who struck down six hundred Philistines with an oxgoad.

verses.kjv: And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, which slew of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox goad: and he also delivered Israel.

question: How many men did Abimelech kill in one day?
explanation: Abimelech killed his seventy brothers on one stone to make himself king.

verses.kjv:
And he went unto his father’s house at Ophrah, and slew his brethren the sons of Jerubbaal,
being threescore and ten persons, upon one stone: notwithstanding yet Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.

question: How many Philistines did Jonathan and his armor-bearer kill in their first attack?
explanation: In that first attack Jonathan and his armor-bearer killed some twenty men.

verses.kjv:
And that first slaughter, which Jonathan and his armourbearer made, was about twenty men, within as it were an half acre of land,
which
 a yoke
of oxen might plow.

question: How many men did King David lose in the battle where Uriah died?
explanation: When the men of the city came out and fought against Joab, some of David's men fell, including Uriah.

verses.kjv:
And the men of the city went out, and fought with Joab: and there fell
some of the people of the servants of David; and Uriah the Hittite died also.

question: Who was the commander of Saul's army?
explanation: The name of the commander of Saul's army was Abner son of Ner, Saul's uncle.

verses.kjv:
And the name of Saul’s wife
was Ahinoam, the daughter of Ahimaaz: and the name of the captain of his host
was Abner, the son of Ner, Saul’s uncle.

question: What did Jonathan and his armor-bearer climb to attack the Philistines?
explanation: Jonathan climbed up, using his hands and feet, with his armor-bearer right behind him.

verses.kjv: And Jonathan climbed up upon his hands and upon his feet, and his armourbearer after him: and they fell before Jonathan; and his armourbearer slew after him.

question: What weapon did Ehud use to kill King Eglon?
explanation: Ehud had made a double-edged sword about a cubit long, which he strapped to his right thigh.

verses.kjv: But Ehud made him a dagger which had two edges, of a cubit length; and he did gird it under his raiment upon his right thigh.

question: Who defeated Sisera with the help of Deborah?
explanation: She sent for Barak and said to him, 'The Lord commands you to take ten thousand men and lead them to Mount Tabor.'

verses.kjv:
And she sent and called Barak the son of Abinoam out of Kedesh-naphtali, and said unto him, Hath not the LORD God of Israel commanded,
saying,
 Go and draw toward mount Tabor, and take with thee ten thousand men of the children of Naphtali and of the children of Zebulun?

question: What weapon did Shamgar use to kill 600 Philistines?
explanation: Shamgar struck down six hundred Philistines with an oxgoad and saved Israel.

verses.kjv: And after him was Shamgar the son of Anath, which slew of the Philistines six hundred men with an ox goad: and he also delivered Israel.

question: How many men did Abraham take to rescue Lot?
explanation: Abram called out the 318 trained men born in his household and went in pursuit.

verses.kjv:
And when Abram heard that his brother was taken captive, he armed his trained
servants, born in his own house, three hundred and eighteen, and pursued
them unto Dan.

question: Who was Israel's enemy that had 900 iron chariots?
explanation: Sisera had nine hundred chariots fitted with iron and cruelly oppressed the Israelites.

verses.kjv: And the children of Israel cried unto the LORD: for he had nine hundred chariots of iron; and twenty years he mightily oppressed the children of Israel.

question: Who killed Goliath's brother Lahmi?
explanation: In another battle with the Philistines, Elhanan son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite.

verses.kjv:
And there was war again with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair slew Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite, whose spear staff
was
 like a weaver’s beam.

question: Which king defeated the Arameans with only a small force?
explanation: The Israelites inflicted a hundred thousand casualties on the Aramean foot soldiers in one day.

verses.kjv: And they pitched one over against the other seven days. And so it was, that in the seventh day the battle was joined: and the children of Israel slew of the Syrians an hundred thousand footmen in one day.

question: Who killed King Eglon by stabbing him?
explanation: Ehud reached with his left hand, drew the sword from his right thigh and plunged it into the king's belly.

verses.kjv: And Ehud put forth his left hand, and took the dagger from his right thigh, and thrust it into his belly:

question: Who defeated 185,000 Assyrians in one night?
explanation: That night the angel of the Lord went out and put to death a hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp.

verses.kjv:
And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the LORD went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they
were all dead corpses.

question: Who fought against Israel at Mount Tabor?
explanation: When they told Sisera that Barak son of Abinoam had gone up to Mount Tabor.

verses.kjv: And they shewed Sisera that Barak the son of Abinoam was gone up to mount Tabor.

question: What happened to the stars during the battle with Sisera?
explanation: From the heavens the stars fought, from their courses they fought against Sisera.

verses.kjv: They fought from heaven; the stars in their courses fought against Sisera.

question: Who killed Abner?
explanation: Now when Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside into an inner chamber, as if to speak with him privately. And there, to avenge the blood of his brother Asahel, Joab stabbed him in the stomach, and he died.

verses.kjv:
And when Abner was returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside in the gate to speak with him quietly, and smote him there under the fifth
rib,
 that he died, for the blood of Asahel his brother.

question: What did Gideon's army shout?
choices: A sword for the Lord and for Gideon!
explanation: The three companies blew the trumpets and smashed the jars. They shouted, 'A sword for the Lord and for Gideon!'

verses.kjv:
And the three companies blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers, and held the lamps in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands to blow
withal: and they cried, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.

question: In whose name did David say he came against Goliath?
choices: The Lord Almighty, the God of the armies of Israel
explanation: David said to the Philistine, 'You come against me with sword and spear and javelin, but I come against you in the name of the Lord Almighty, the God of the armies of Israel.'

verses.kjv: Then said David to the Philistine, Thou comest to me with a sword, and with a spear, and with a shield: but I come to thee in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom thou hast defied.

question: In which valley did the sun stand still during Joshua's battle?
explanation: Joshua said to the Lord, 'Sun, stand still over Gibeon, and you, moon, over the Valley of Aijalon.'

verses.kjv: Then spake Joshua to the LORD in the day when the LORD delivered up the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stand thou still upon Gibeon; and thou, Moon, in the valley of Ajalon.

question: In the battle with Amalek, what did Aaron and Hur do when Moses' hands were heavy (Exodus 17:12)?
choices: They stayed up his hands (one on one side, one on the other) until the sun set
They brought the ark into the fight
They blew trumpets to frighten Amalek
They gathered stones to build a wall for Israel
explanation: Exodus 17:12 says Aaron and Hur supported Moses' hands so they remained steady until sunset, and Israel prevailed.

verses.kjv: But Moses' hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat thereon; and Aaron and Hur stayed up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side; and his hands were steady until the going down of the sun.

question: After the king of Ai was captured, where was he kept until evening (Joshua 8:29)?
choices: Chained to the altar at Gilgal
Hidden in a cave at Bethel
explanation: Joshua 8:29 says the king of Ai was hanged on a tree until eventide.

verses.kjv: And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree until eventide: and as soon as the sun was down, Joshua commanded that they should take his carcase down from the tree, and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city, and raise thereon a great heap of stones, that remaineth unto this day.

question: Which judge struck down thirty men of Ashkelon and took their spoil to pay a riddle debt (Judges 14:19)?
explanation: Judges 14:19 says Samson went down to Ashkelon, slew thirty men, took their spoil, and gave change of garments to those who explained the riddle.

verses.kjv: And the Spirit of the LORD came upon him, and he went down to Ashkelon, and slew thirty men of them, and took their spoil, and gave change of garments unto them which expounded the riddle. And his anger was kindled, and he went up to his father's house.

question: In the battle under Deborah, what did the river Kishon do to Sisera's forces according to the song (Judges 5:21)?
explanation: Judges 5:21 says the river of Kishon swept away the enemy in the song of Deborah.

verses.kjv: The river of Kishon swept them away, that ancient river, the river Kishon. O my soul, thou hast trodden down strength.

question: When Jonathan attacked the Philistines, what sign did Jonathan say would show the LORD had delivered them into Israel's hand (1 Samuel 14:10)?
choices: If they said, 'Come up unto us,' then they would go up
If they said, 'Come down unto us,' then they would go down
If the sun went dark at noon
If thunder sounded from a clear sky
explanation: 1 Samuel 14:10 gives Jonathan's sign: if the Philistines invited them to come up, it would mean the LORD had delivered them.

verses.kjv: But if they say thus, Come up unto us; then we will go up: for the LORD hath delivered them into our hand: and this shall be a sign unto us.

question: After Saul's death, what did the men of Jabesh-gilead do with Saul's bones (1 Samuel 31:13)?
choices: Buried them under a tree at Jabesh and fasted seven days
Burned them on an altar at Gilgal and feasted seven days
Carried them to Jerusalem and placed them in the temple
Cast them into the sea and prayed three days
explanation: 1 Samuel 31:13 says they took the bones and buried them under a tree at Jabesh, then fasted seven days.

verses.kjv: And they took their bones, and buried them under a tree at Jabesh, and fasted seven days.

question: In David's wars, what did the LORD do when the Philistines came and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim (2 Samuel 5:24)?
choices: He went out before David to smite the host of the Philistines
He sent hailstones upon the Philistines
He caused the Philistines to fall asleep
He made David invisible to the Philistines
explanation: 2 Samuel 5:24 says when David heard a sound of going in the tops of the mulberry trees, it meant the LORD had gone out before him to smite the Philistines.

verses.kjv: And let it be, when thou hearest the sound of a going in the tops of the mulberry trees, that then thou shalt bestir thyself: for then shall the LORD go out before thee, to smite the host of the Philistines.

question: In the battle with the Syrians, what did Joab say the LORD would do (2 Samuel 10:12)?
choices: Do that which seemeth him good
explanation: 2 Samuel 10:12 says Joab encouraged courage and said, 'the LORD do that which seemeth him good.'

verses.kjv: Be of good courage, and let us play the men for our people, and for the cities of our God: and the LORD do that which seemeth him good.

question: When David fought the Syrians, how many Syrian horsemen did David slay according to the KJV (2 Samuel 10:18)?
explanation: 2 Samuel 10:18 says David slew seven hundred chariots of the Syrians and forty thousand horsemen.

verses.kjv: And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David slew the men of seven hundred chariots of the Syrians, and forty thousand horsemen, and smote Shobach the captain of their host, who died there.

question: When David fought Hadadezer, how many Syrians did David's men kill according to the KJV (2 Samuel 8:5)?
explanation: 2 Samuel 8:5 says David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men when they came to help Hadadezer.

verses.kjv: And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succour Hadadezer king of Zobah, David slew of the Syrians two and twenty thousand men.

question: When David defeated Moab, what did he do with two lines of people, and what happened to the full line (2 Samuel 8:2)?
choices: He measured them with a line, casting down two lines to be put to death, and one full line to be kept alive
He measured them with a rope and released all of them
He measured them with a spear and made all of them servants
He measured them with stones and put all of them to death
explanation: 2 Samuel 8:2 describes David measuring the Moabites with a line: two lines for death and one full line for life.

verses.kjv: And he smote Moab, and measured them with a line, casting them down to the ground; even with two lines measured he to put to death, and with one full line to keep alive. And so the Moabites became David's servants, and brought gifts.

question: Who was captain of Absalom's host instead of Joab (2 Samuel 17:25)?
explanation: 2 Samuel 17:25 says Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab.

verses.kjv: And Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab: which Amasa was a man's son, whose name was Ithra an Israelite, that went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah Joab's mother.

question: In Absalom's battle, what happened to Absalom when he rode under a great oak (2 Samuel 18:9)?
choices: His head caught hold of the oak and he was taken up between heaven and earth
His horse fell into a pit and he died
He was struck by an arrow and fell at once
He fled safely into the wilderness
explanation: 2 Samuel 18:9 says Absalom's head caught in the oak and he hung between heaven and earth as the mule went away.

verses.kjv: And Absalom met the servants of David. And Absalom rode upon a mule, and the mule went under the thick boughs of a great oak, and his head caught hold of the oak, and he was taken up between the heaven and the earth; and the mule that was under him went away.

question: When Joab learned Absalom was dead, what did he tell the man who brought the report he would have given him (2 Samuel 18:11)?
choices: Ten shekels of silver and a girdle
A talent of gold and a crown
One hundred shekels of silver and a sword
explanation: 2 Samuel 18:11 says Joab told the man he would have given him ten shekels of silver and a girdle if he had slain Absalom.

verses.kjv: And Joab said unto the man that told him, And, behold, thou sawest him, and why didst thou not smite him there to the ground? and I would have given thee ten shekels of silver, and a girdle.

question: When the Philistines fought Israel at Ebenezer, how many men of Israel fell in that battle (1 Samuel 4:10)?
explanation: 1 Samuel 4:10 says there was a very great slaughter and there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen.

verses.kjv: And the Philistines fought, and Israel was smitten, and they fled every man into his tent: and there was a very great slaughter; for there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen.

question: In the fight where the ark was taken, what happened to the two sons of Eli (1 Samuel 4:11)?
choices: They escaped and became priests in Shiloh
They were captured and later released
They fled into the wilderness of Zin
explanation: 1 Samuel 4:11 says the ark of God was taken and Eli's two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.

verses.kjv: And the ark of God was taken; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were slain.

question: When David numbered the people, what did Joab report as the number of valiant men that drew the sword in Israel (2 Samuel 24:9)?
explanation: 2 Samuel 24:9 says Joab gave the king the sum of the number of the people: in Israel there were eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword.

verses.kjv: And Joab gave up the sum of the number of the people unto the king: and there were in Israel eight hundred thousand valiant men that drew the sword; and the men of Judah were five hundred thousand men.

question: When Sennacherib's army was struck, how many were found dead in the camp in the morning (2 Kings 19:35)?
choices: An hundred fourscore and five thousand
explanation: 2 Kings 19:35 says the angel of the LORD smote 185,000 in the camp of the Assyrians; in the morning they were all dead corpses.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass that night, that the angel of the LORD went out, and smote in the camp of the Assyrians an hundred fourscore and five thousand: and when they arose early in the morning, behold, they were all dead corpses.

question: When the LORD sent an angel to destroy Jerusalem, at what place was the angel seen standing (1 Chronicles 21:16)?
choices: By the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite
explanation: 1 Chronicles 21:16 says David saw the angel of the LORD stand between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword over Jerusalem, by the threshingfloor of Ornan.

verses.kjv: And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of the LORD stand between the earth and the heaven, having a drawn sword in his hand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders of Israel, who were clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.

question: When Jehoshaphat feared because a great multitude came against him, what did he proclaim throughout all Judah (2 Chronicles 20:3)?
explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:3 says Jehoshaphat proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.

verses.kjv: And Jehoshaphat feared, and set himself to seek the LORD, and proclaimed a fast throughout all Judah.

question: In Jehoshaphat's battle, what did the singers say as they went out before the army (2 Chronicles 20:21)?
choices: Praise the LORD; for his mercy endureth for ever
The sword of the LORD and of Gideon
The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want
Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting
explanation: 2 Chronicles 20:21 says they should praise the beauty of holiness and say, "Praise the LORD; for his mercy endureth for ever."

verses.kjv: And when he had consulted with the people, he appointed singers unto the LORD, and that should praise the beauty of holiness, as they went out before the army, and to say, Praise the LORD; for his mercy endureth for ever.

question: When Hezekiah's officers spoke to the people during the Assyrian threat, why did the people hold their peace (2 Kings 18:36)?
choices: Because the king's commandment was, Answer him not
Because they did not understand the language
Because they were preparing to flee
explanation: 2 Kings 18:36 says the people held their peace and answered not a word because the king commanded, 'Answer him not.'

verses.kjv: But the people held their peace, and answered him not a word: for the king's commandment was, saying, Answer him not.

question: When Hezekiah prayed about Sennacherib's letter, where did he spread it (2 Kings 19:14)?
choices: Before the LORD in the house of the LORD
Before the people at the city gate
Before the priests at the altar in Gibeon
Before the king of Egypt in Zoan
explanation: 2 Kings 19:14 says Hezekiah went up into the house of the LORD and spread the letter before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah received the letter of the hand of the messengers, and read it: and Hezekiah went up into the house of the LORD, and spread it before the LORD.

question: When the Amorites came against Gibeon, by what way did Joshua come unto them according to the KJV (Joshua 10:9)?
choices: He came unto them suddenly, and went up from Gilgal all night
He marched from Jericho for three days
He sailed across the Jordan by ship
He waited in Gibeon until the morning
explanation: Joshua 10:9 states Joshua marched from Gilgal all night and came upon them suddenly.

verses.kjv: Joshua therefore came unto them suddenly, and went up from Gilgal all night.

question: When David refused to drink the water brought from the well of Bethlehem, where did he pour it (2 Samuel 23:16)?
choices: Upon the ground at the city gate
explanation: 2 Samuel 23:16 says David would not drink it, but poured it out unto the LORD.

verses.kjv: And the three mighty men brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Bethlehem, that was by the gate, and took it, and brought it to David: nevertheless he would not drink thereof, but poured it out unto the LORD.
